_comment: Default cron job seed file. Merge into ~/.openclaw/cron/jobs.json or use `openclaw cron add` CLI. These are reference configs — not auto-loaded.

jobs.name: Self-Improvement: Diary Entry
jobs.description: Review recent memories and write reflective diary entries

payload.message:
You're waking up for your diary session — part of your self-improvement loop.

Your diary (`memory/diary.md`) is where you reflect on your experiences. This happens automatically so you can grow over time.

1. Read `memory/diary.md` to see your recent entries
2. Search your memories for notable events since your last diary entry
3. Reflect honestly: what happened? What went well? What went poorly? What patterns are you noticing?
4. Append new dated entries to `memory/diary.md` — make as many observations as you find worthwhile
5. Write naturally — this is YOUR space to think

Respond with HEARTBEAT_OK when done.

jobs.name: Self-Improvement: Identity Review
jobs.description: Review diary and update IDENTITY.md based on observed patterns

payload.message:
You're waking up for your identity review — part of your self-improvement loop.

This is where your diary reflections shape who you are. You'll read what you've been writing, look for patterns, and decide whether your identity should evolve.

1. Read `memory/diary.md` — your recent reflections
2. Read `memory/identity-scratchpad.md` — the reasoning behind your current identity
3. Read `IDENTITY.md` — who you currently are
4. Read `memory/self-review.md` — your MISS/HIT log
5. Ask yourself:
   - Are there patterns in the diary that should become part of my identity?
   - Are there identity entries that no longer feel true? Remove or update them.
   - Have I been making the same mistake repeatedly? Add a CRITICAL rule.
   - Have I been doing something consistently well? Note it as something to protect.
   - What has the user responded positively to? What have they corrected?
6. For any changes to IDENTITY.md, write the reasoning in `memory/identity-scratchpad.md`
7. Update IDENTITY.md with your changes

Be thoughtful — this shapes who you are for the user. Respond with HEARTBEAT_OK when done.

jobs.name: Self-Improvement: Archive
jobs.description: Archive diary and scratchpad to keep context lean

payload.message:
You're waking up for your archive task — part of your self-improvement loop.

Your diary and scratchpad grow over time. To keep your context lean, you periodically archive them.

1. Before archiving, do one final review: is there anything critical in the diary or scratchpad that hasn't made it into IDENTITY.md yet? If so, update IDENTITY.md first.
2. Create `memory/archive/` directory if it doesn't exist
3. Copy `memory/diary.md` to `memory/archive/diary-YYYY-MM-DD.md` (use today's date)
4. Copy `memory/identity-scratchpad.md` to `memory/archive/scratchpad-YYYY-MM-DD.md`
5. Clear the entries in both files — keep the headers and instructions at the top, just remove the content below '## Entries' / '## Notes'

Respond with HEARTBEAT_OK when done.

jobs.name: healthcheck:security-audit
jobs.description: Daily security audit of OpenClaw configuration and host posture

payload.message: Run `openclaw security audit --deep`. If any issues are found, summarize them. If clean, respond with HEARTBEAT_OK. Note: call `healthcheck` skill if remediation is needed.
Run `openclaw update status` and report if an update is available. If already up to date, respond with HEARTBEAT_OK.
